articles.title: Wiegman gets honorary damehood in New Year Honours
articles.summary: Ice skaters Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean become a dame and knight in the New Year Honours list, while England women's manager Sarina Wiegman is made an honorary dame.

articles.title: Honours for football executives who helped save Celtic and Hearts
articles.summary: Former Celtic chief executive Fergus McCann and ex-Hearts chair Ann Budge have been recognised in the New Year Honours.

articles.title: 'Let's make history' - Miura, 58, joins new club
articles.summary: Kazuyoshi Miura, who turns 59 in February and is the world's oldest professional footballer, has signed a loan deal until June with Fukushima United.

articles.title: How to follow the Premier League on the BBC this week
articles.summary: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend.

articles.title: Slegers: How Arsenal won the Champions League
articles.summary: Renee Slegers rubs her face and draws a huge breath when asked what it feels like when she tries to take in the achievement of winning the biggest club competition in the game.

articles.title: Forest ask for VAR audio after Man City defeat
articles.summary: Nottingham Forest have asked to hear the VAR audio as they consider making an official complaint following the Premier League defeat by Manchester City.

articles.title: Sutton's predictions v singer-songwriter & Sunderland fan Tom A Smith
articles.summary: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on singer-songwriter and Sunderland fan Tom A Smith - and AI - with his predictions for this week's Premier League fixtures.

articles.title: Arsenal 'actively looking' at January signings
articles.summary: Arsenal will be "actively looking" at potential signings during the January transfer window, says manager Mikel Arteta.

articles.title: Man Utd sign Germany forward with  'phenomenal' goals record
articles.summary: Manchester United have signed Germany international Lea Schuller from Bayern Munich until June 2029.

articles.title: Title talk in December 'doesn't make sense' - Emery
articles.summary: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery says it "does not make sense" to speak about the title race in December, after rising to third place in the Premier League.

articles.title: How Raya was able to execute 'absolutely brilliant' save against Brighton
articles.summary: Match of the day Pundit Joe Hart breaks down how David Raya was able to execute an 'absolutely brilliant' save for Arsenal in their 2-1 victory over Brighton.

articles.title: All your FPL stats and Premier League team news in one place
articles.summary: Every key bit of Premier League team news and the most important Fantasy Premier League statistics - all in one place.

articles.title: Motherwell seek answer from SFA after no Ibrox penalty
articles.summary: Motherwell are seeking an explanation for a rejected penalty claim at Ibrox, although manager Jens Berthel Askou is keen to move on from the incident.

articles.title: West Ham to back Nuno in January window
articles.summary: Relegation-threatened West Ham are committed to backing manager Nuno Espirito Santo in the transfer market next month.

articles.title: Ronaldo will not retire until he scores 1,000 goals
articles.summary: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo says he will not end his playing career until he scores his 1,000th career goal.

highlights.title: Premier League highlights this week - Week Highlights

articles.title: Can 'Champagne Charlie' upset Van Veen and reach Ally Pally quarter-finals?
articles.summary: 'Champagne' Charlie Manby takes on Gian van Veen at the World Darts Championship on Tuesday with a quarter-final spot on the line.

articles.title: Leeds 'brimming with confidence' in full-team goal - Hart
articles.summary: Match of the Day pundits  Joe Hart and Danny Murphy praise Leeds United's build-up play, which resulted in Dominic Calvert-Lewin's equaliser against Sunderland.

articles.title: Manby continues dream run at Ally Pally while Aspinall suffers exit
articles.summary: Charlie Manby reached the last 16 of the World Darts Championship on debut after defeating 'Rapid' Ricky Evans 4-2 as crowd-favourite Nathan Aspinall was knocked out.

articles.title: Littler overcomes Cross and crowd jeers to battle into quarter-finals
articles.summary: World No 1 Luke Littler is through to the quarter-finals of the World Darts Championship after battling to a 4-2 victory over former world champion Rob Cross at the Alexandra Palace.

articles.title: Calvert-Lewin earns draw for Leeds at Sunderland
articles.summary: Dominic Calvert-Lewin scores his seventh goal in six games for Leeds United to draw 1-1 with Sunderland.

articles.title: Football Daily
articles.summary: Katie Smith and guests look back on England’s dramatic Women’s Euros campaign.
